Entitlement Name: Alteryx Designer Advanced Certification Exam Preparation

List the tools, topics, and requirements of the Alteryx Designer Advanced Exam. 

Identify the best practices and techniques to prepare for and take the exam.

Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer with the Data Investigation tool palette enabled. 

General Alteryx knowledge and proficiency in data preparation, transformation, and manipulation is essential.

Entitlement Name: Alteryx Designer Core Certification Exam Preparation

A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer with the Data Investigation tool palette enabled. 

General Alteryx knowledge and proficiency in data preparation, transformation, and manipulation is essential. 

Completion of the Explore Data Quality and Scope with Data Investigation Tools course is recommended.

A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer. 

Alteryx Intelligence Suite Installation.

- Turn on Customer Managed Telemetry & direct data to a structured DB
- Develop workflow that turns data into insights
- Connects CMT data into a solution repository that tells value stories (akin to use cases) - set custom parameters to say "if a workflow meets these criteria and does NOT exist in the repository, automatically prompt user with a survey'. Set this up so it self updates on a cadence
- Support these automated efforts with manual interviews (current offering)
- From these efforts, trigger a holistic, account-level value deliverable - aggregate impact, highlights of key stories, analytics around where impact is being felt

Not Included:

•	Multi-environment setup or multi-account automation.
•	Custom dashboard or visualization development beyond provided outputs.

Entitlement Name: Apply Advanced Data Preparation Techniques with Multi-Tools
Outcome:
Parse messy data with the Regular Expression (RegEx) tool. 

Efficiently process data vertically and horizontally with Multi-Tools.

A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer. 

An Alteryx Community account is required.

Entitlement Name: Automate Data Validation in Your Workflows
Outcome: Validate data dynamically in workflows by using automated tracking and testing checkpoints.
Delivery Details: Do you build large workflows that join multiple datasets together? Learn how to insert checkpoints in your workflows that automate tracking and testing to ensure your data is accurate, clean, and easy to troubleshoot.

Outcome: Create a macro that iterates a process until the data meets your desired conditions.
Delivery Details: Ready to take your macro-building skills to the next level with automation? Having prior knowledge of standard or batch macros is highly recommended to enhance your learning experience in this course.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Alteryx Auto Insights is required.

Outcome: Apply governance best practices to effectively manage, document, and share workflows in Alteryx Designer.

You’ll learn how to maintain the agility of Alteryx while applying structured governance for sensitive data and repeatable processes.
Pre-Requisites:
Knowledge of how to set up connections to databases or other data sources is recommended. 

Knowledge of Alteryx Server Gallery is recommended.

Outcome: Create and chain analytic apps together to display a dynamic interface that updates results based on user selections.

Not Included:

•	Creation of service accounts or identity provider changes.
•	Workflow development or modification.
•	Resolution of product defects or Support tickets.

Delivery Details: Consultation on DCM's fit with requirements of InfoSec | Engagement w/ Ayx Admin, IDP & IT Stakeholders | Demo of Delegated vs. Application apis | Combines practical Quickstart w/ Server advisory | Concludes w/ IT approved DCM connection executing WFs in Prod envmt (CEFD included)

Entitlement Name: Explore Data Quality and Scope with Data Investigation Tools
Outcome: Explore the data quality and scope of a dataset using the Field Summary, Frequency Table, Histogram, and Distribution Analysis tools.
Delivery Details:
In this course, you will explore data quality and scope using Data Investigation tools. These tools will help you assess data cleanliness and analyze frequency and distribution, providing insights into the shape and characteristics of your data and guiding you in choosing the best approaches and tools for your analysis.  

You will develop the skills to identify what is significant, detect issues like outliers and null values, analyze how data is distributed within fields, and determine whether the data is ready for use in future predictive models.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer is required.

Entitlement Name: Explore Data Relationship with Data Investigation Tools
Outcome: Use the Data Investigation tools to uncover and account for relationships and associations to determine which data elements are suitable for predictive modeling.
Delivery Details: In this course, you will explore key data relationships—correlation, collinearity, and association—to uncover patterns and influences within your dataset. By using the Data Investigation tools, you will learn how variables interact, identify redundancies, and recognize meaningful connections. These relationship types can determine how you set up a predictive model, and how to best work with your data in other analyses.
Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer with the Data Investigation tool palette enabled.

General Alteryx knowledge and proficiency in data preparation, transformation, and manipulation is essential.

Completion of the Explore Data Quality and Scope with Data Investigation Tools course is recommended.

Entitlement Name: Gather Insights from PDFs with CV Tools
Outcome: Build a workflow using Computer Vision tools to automate the extraction of information from PDFs.
Delivery Details: Join this hands-on course to discover how Computer Vision tools can help you extract and analyze information out of PDFs efficiently. Designer Core certification is recommended, and Intelligence Suite installation is required.
Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer.

Alteryx Intelligence Suite Installation.

Outcome:
Navigate the Alteryx Designer user interface. 

Locate Alteryx resources and Help documentation. 

Build your first Designer workflow.
Delivery Details: In this course, you learn how to navigate the Designer user interface, locate essential resources, and build your first workflow to solve some common data challenges. If you are just starting your journey with Alteryx, this course will set you up for success.
Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer.

An Alteryx Community account is required.

Outcome:
Navigate the Server user interface. 

Organize, run, and schedule workflows in Server.
Delivery Details: Discover the power of Alteryx Server to automate your processes. In this course, which includes a demonstration, you will learn how to navigate the Server user interface and how to organize, run, and schedule workflows in Server. This course does not include hands-on activities.
Pre-Requisites: A license of Alteryx Server is recommended.

Outcome:
Create your first Mission using Auto Insights. 

Generate a PowerPoint presentation using Magic Documents.
Delivery Details: Say goodbye to static dashboards that only answer half your questions. With Alteryx Auto Insights, uncover clear, trustworthy explanations of your data to make informed decisions. Learn how to personalize your data story, leverage machine learning to surface key patterns, and understand the "why" behind your results. This introductory course will walk you through the core features of Auto Insights, helping you transform raw data into actionable business insights.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Alteryx Auto Insights is required.

Entitlement Name: Get Started with Data Connection Manager
Outcome:
Define the key benefits of using DCM. 

Identify different ways to set up and configure DCM for Alteryx Designer and Server. 

Identify how to share connections to collaborate in Server environments.
Delivery Details: This course teaches the foundational concepts of data connection management in Alteryx Designer and Server. During this course, you will learn about the key benefits of using Data Connection Manager (DCM), how to set up and configure DCM in Designer and Server, and how to share connections to collaborate in Server environments.
Pre-Requisites:
Knowledge of how to set up connections to databases or other data sources is recommended.

Knowledge of Alteryx Server Gallery is recommended.

Outcome:
Navigate the Designer Cloud interface. 

Read in data and build your first workflow. 

Use the Interactive Results Grid for faster, guided data transformation powered by AI.

Discover how to prep, blend, and automate your Designer Cloud workflows in a transparent, repeatable way.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Designer Cloud.

Delivery Details: A virtual customer Q&A gathering data on the customer environment, workflow risk, policies & procedures, and other topics such as workflow orphans (no owners). Output includes a PPT governance plan that can be executed by the customer, a partner, or Alteryx consultants

Not Included: Implementation of governance assessment workplan output; Guidance or assessment outside the 1 hour Q&A session

Entitlement Name: Governance Framework for Permissions & Access Controls in Alteryx Server
Outcome:
Secure & Compliant Access – Right people, right roles, right environment.

Automated User Lifecycle – Onboarding/offboarding via AD/SSO with no manual intervention.

Clear Ownership – Every shared asset has accountable Business and Technical owners.

Efficient Administration – Reduced manual effort in managing permissions and collections.

Governance Visibility – Regular audits and telemetry provide clear insight into usage and risks.
Delivery Details: With SAML + SCIM-Provisioned Group-Based Access Control (GBAC), Alteryx Server automatically syncs users and groups from Entra ID so authentication, role assignment, and collection permissions are centrally managed, consistent, and audit-ready in 1 environment (Recommend PROD)
Pre-Requisites: 1 hr planning session with IT Admin to align to scope; SSO (SCIM) configured; Can be configured with or without approvals
Not Included: Not supporting more than 1 server environment

Entitlement Name: MongoDB to SQL Migration Workflow Utility
Deliverable: Working Session / Install to help configure this workflow and complete the migration. I imagine something similar to the Authentication Change entitlement in this case.
Outcome: Support for migrating MongoDB to SQL DB. During this activity the customer will meet with a member of our PS team who will help them configure the migration workflow, reviews errors and log to confirm a successful migration of their persistence layer.
Delivery Details: Customer must meet all prereqs, SB migration test and validation and then schedule production dates
Pre-Requisites:
Customer must be on Alteryx Server v. 24.1 and higher. Preparation and Backup:
Schedule Server downtime and take the Alteryx Server offline.
Perform a backup of the existing MongoDB database using the AlteryxService emongodump command.
SQL Server Setup:
Ensure an MSSQL Server instance (e.g., MSSQL Server 2019 or 2022) is hosted and network accessible from your Alteryx Server controllers.
Create a separate SQL database for Alteryx Gallery/Alteryx Service.
Install necessary SQL Server drivers.
Not Included:
SQL Server Setup:
Ensure an MSSQL Server instance (e.g., MSSQL Server 2019 or 2022) is hosted and network accessible from your Alteryx Server controllers.
Create a separate SQL database for Alteryx Gallery/Alteryx Service.
Install necessary SQL Server drivers.

Any other product limitation and SQL troubleshooting aspects we should not include. Worth reviewing this section in detail as a team.

Outcome:
Cleanse and prepare imperfect data for use in downstream analysis. 

Write expressions in the Formula tool.
Delivery Details:
Start your journey to clean and prepare data with Alteryx Designer! This beginner-friendly course introduces you to essential data preparation tools and the power of Designer’s expression editor. You will learn how to calculate, filter, sample, and sort data with ease, setting the stage for seamless downstream analysis. If you are new to Designer, this course is the perfect way to build a strong foundation for your data workflows.  

Note: This content overlaps with the Designer Desktop Foundations course, so choose the course that best fits your learning goals.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer.

Entitlement Name: Reshape Your Data with Parse and Transform Tools
Outcome:
Parse data to rows and columns with delimiters. 

Pivot the orientation of data to better suit your analysis. 

Summarize data to answer business questions.
Delivery Details: Unlock the full potential of your data with Alteryx Designer! Dive into transformation techniques to parse datasets into columns, pivot data, and summarize key metrics. Learn how to reshape and enrich your data to uncover valuable insights and answer critical business questions. If you are ready to go beyond the basics, this course builds on foundational skills (including some overlap with the Translate Excel Processes to Designer Desktop course) to help you master powerful data transformation tools.
Pre-Requisites: A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer

Outcome: A fully configured sandbox environment deployed and accessible to users.
Delivery Details: Sandbox environment deployed with appropriate user access and controls. Validation that designer users can access.
Pre-Requisites: Customer must have a licensed sandbox and infrastructure requests approved internally.
Not Included: Initial draft our outline or workflow promotion process. Separate entitlement.

Outcome:
Create a macro that streamlines repetitive workflow processes by batching record groups. 

Share a macro with other users.
Delivery Details: Are you using numerous Filter tools to run separate processes on different groups of data? Discover how to harness the power of batch macros to group data into batches and process them one at a time. In this course, you will learn when to consider and how to both create and share a batch macro. Having prior knowledge of standard macros is highly recommended to enhance your learning experience in this course.
Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer

Proficiency with the Interface tool palette and creating Macros in Designer

Entitlement Name: See the Future: Time Series Modeling
Outcome:
Describe the main components of time series analysis. 

Create a time-based model using historical data.
Delivery Details: Ever wonder how to anticipate what is next using your data? In this interactive course, you will uncover the secrets of time series analysis and forecasting. Learn how to identify patterns, analyze trends, and predict future behavior based on past observations. Ideal for anyone working with time-based data, this course requires a basic understanding of predictive models and a prior download of the Predictive tools.
Pre-Requisites:
A licensed copy of Alteryx Designer

Predictive tools installation

Entitlement Name: Text Mining and Sentiment Analysis in AIS

Delivery Details:
Working session with the customer for optimization advisory for 1 workflow. 
This is designed to optimize a pre-existing workflow in line with Alteryx workflow best practices. 
Workflows optimization will have 3 working sessions along with initial data discovery session.
Pre-Requisites: Pre-built Alteryx workflow, along with availability of the business user for the working sessions.
Not Included:
Creation of workflows; Any Additional working sessions beyond the allotted 2 use-case working sessions. Completion of optimization in not guaranteed under this entitlement.
For more complex workflow, customer may choose to continue work with a custom scoped Professional Services engagement

Entitlement Name: Workflow Promotion Design: Sandbox to Production
Outcome: Documented workflow promotion framework approved by stakeholders. Defined roles and responsibilities for development, review and promotion.
Delivery Details:
Alteryx Services partners with technical and business stakeholders to assess the current state, define promotion standards, and document a workflow promotion framework that aligns with enterprise governance and operational best practices.
The result is a shared, approved process that improves reliability, auditability, and confidence in production analytics.
Pre-Requisites:
A sandbox or test environment in place.
Defined production environment or workspace (Server or AACP).
Availability of analytics, platform, and governance stakeholders.
Existing workflows using Alteryx Favorites (Core) tools.
Not Included:
Hands-on implementation of promotion automation.
Workflow redevelopment or optimization.
Use of advanced or non-Core tools (Predictive, Intelligence Suite, Python/R).
Execution of promotions or environment changes
